## All Live Peers for Band


Here is a script for you to update `persistent_peers` setting in `config.toml`. Stale peers can cause node inefficiency over time, so the script below selects a few random live peers.

```bash
PEERS=8d62dfa437917bff46c18b650fab3cb7091554db@141.94.73.39:38656,2cacea96ad46392ce733bb7fe009ce9a142da137@37.27.61.49:11656,2d7b93da6155a20298c3ceb952cee1fd7a9cd2d0@136.144.51.169:36656,3b1c206510bd1675d06c0d8a367da67776b597e6@65.109.50.183:26656,ce7f7453e2b306bc670057e9055b142af2424b53@65.108.12.253:26656
sed -i.bak -e "s/^persistent_peers *=.*/persistent_peers = \"$PEERS\"/" ~/.band/config/config.toml

sudo systemctl restart bandd.service
sudo journalctl -fu bandd.service --no-hostname -o cat
```

## Ours Peer for Band
When you state-sync, you might also consider adding [NODERS]TEAM state-sync peer to your persistent_peers setting in `config.toml`.

```bash
@:
```
